metadata.synopsis: The InParty for Gale while in END_Main.Morphic Pool (Arrival)Astral Plane (Just after Netherbrain Confrontation)Tadpole Choice (with Emperor in Astral Plane while making the choice to transform into a mind flayer. Gale can be the mind flayer)High Hall Interior (after Astral Plane, views of Nautiloids, Dragons, and a city in ruin)

14.speaker: Gale
14.text: It seems the brain's more reluctant to let go of the crown than we anticipated.

30.speaker: Gale
30.text: Separating the crown from that monstrosity will be harder than we imagined. It might be time to reconsider our strategy.
30.context: NodeContext: Cogs beginnign to whir. He might end up offering to blow himself up after this

19.speaker: Gale
19.text: We've a city to save. I think it's about time we got started.

20.speaker: Gale
20.text: Quite the choice you're faced with: surrender the Netherstones to a mind flayer, or surrender your soul and become one.
20.context: NodeContext: Serious, this is a big decision

63.speaker: Gale
63.text: If you need advice, I'll do my best - though I have to say I've not much to draw on in this case. It's rather a unique predicament to have landed yourself with.
63.context: NodeContext: Serious, this is a big decision

50.speaker: Player
50.text: Actually, that's not why I wanted to talk to you. It's about the orb...

91.speaker: Gale
91.text: The orb? Why ever would we need to talk about that?

68.speaker: Gale
68.text: I assure you it remains stable as ever, in spite of our encounter with the Netherbrain.

36.speaker: Gale
36.text: The Karsite Weave is primed for godhood, as soon as we have the Crown within our grasp.

92.speaker: Player
92.text: Gale... I think we should consider using the orb as Mystra intended. To blow up the Netherbrain.

89.speaker: Gale
89.text: I stand here on the precipice of divinity - a course you encouraged me to pursue, I might add - and now you come to tell me to blow myself up?

76.speaker: Gale
76.text: I'm getting rather tired of how often those I care about seem to reach the same conclusion.

59.speaker: Gale
59.text: Even you - after the dreams we've shared.

44.speaker: Gale
44.text: Why exactly would I choose that course now, when I have so much to live for?

29.speaker: Player
29.text: We're facing a Netherbrain. Lose, and you'll never become a god anyway.

81.speaker: Gale
81.text: Pessimism like that is hardly going to improve our chances. But - I will begrudgingly admit that circumstances have somewhat changed.
81.context: NodeContext: Scoffing a bit, but reluctantly acknowledging you're not wrong

4.speaker: Gale
4.text: I still prefer my odds if I don't turn myself into a crater the size of the Lower City.
4.context: NodeContext: bit of an edge to it - pissed off that you suggested it

42.speaker: Gale
42.text: I sense your resolve falters, so allow me to provide some encouragement: we are not going to lose, and I am going to get that crown.
42.context: NodeContext: bit of an edge to it - pissed off that you suggested it

28.speaker: Gale
28.text: Now, let's drop the matter, before I feel obliged to detonate the orb just to put an end to the bloody business altogether.
28.context: NodeContext: bit of an edge to it - pissed off that you suggested it

94.speaker: Gale
94.text: As for your current predicament - it doesn't matter to me who holds the Netherstones, so long as they they are mine to claim once the brain is dispatched.

41.speaker: Gale
41.text: Beyond that, the choice is yours to make, and I wouldn't dare to impose myself on one faced with making such a sacrifice.
41.context: NodeContext: A bit snippy - making a point of not trying to convince the player as they just did with him

3.speaker: Player
3.text: You won't get the Crown from the Netherbrain without my help. I won't let you.

53.speaker: Gale
53.text: Come now - turning on each other will hardly improve our chances of survival.
53.context: NodeContext: hint of an eye roll - you're really trying that shit on me? a bit annoyed you tried

58.speaker: Gale
58.text: However, the sharpest tongues sometimes make the finest points. And your urgency is not unwarranted -  our circumstances have changed.
58.context: NodeContext: With a sigh - reluctantly accepting he needs to think more carefully on this

55.speaker: Gale
55.text: The elder brain was already a formidable foe, but the Netherbrain is on the cusp of achieving a godhood of its own.
55.context: NodeContext: The stakes of the matter - the netherbrain is nigh on unstoppable

82.speaker: Gale
82.text: Sacrificing myself to destroy it wasn't exactly the form of immortality I hoped for, but perhaps the time for hope has passed altogether. Now we need certainty.
82.context: NodeContext: trying to convince himself of this path, grim/gloomy as he comes to terms with it

18.speaker: Gale
18.text: So be it - I will be ready, whatever you decide.

97.speaker: Player
97.text: You're being selfish. You're risking all of our lives, our souls even - for the chance to make yourself immortal.

71.speaker: Gale
71.text: Is that not the very nature of chasing divinity?

47.speaker: Gale
47.text: The risk will be well worth the gain - we need only to hold our nerve through these final tribulations, and the crown will be ours. Everything will be ours.

67.speaker: Player
67.text: You're right. It's too late to change course now. We need to claim the crown.

26.speaker: Gale
26.text: Good. We'll put that little outburst down to the shock of the circumstances, and move swiftly on.

98.speaker: Gale
98.text: You'll soon have far greater things to be glad of - I promise you that.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: What do you think I should do?

22.speaker: Gale
22.text: As it stands, I see no option free of sacrifice in one form or another. So the question becomes - what are you willing to give up?

13.speaker: Gale
13.text: Relinquish the stones, and you place your fate in the hands of a creature whose trustworthiness is hardly guaranteed.

24.speaker: Gale
24.text: Keep the stones, and you relinquish the very essence of your being. Your soul, your emotions, your purpose. You would lose everything, and might live with such a loss for eternity.

110.speaker: Gale
110.text: All I can say is - whatever choice you make, if it leads us to taking the Crown it will be worth it. And I will ensure you are well taken care of.

21.speaker: Gale
21.text: Whatever you decide, do not delay for too long. Every moment we hesitate, the Crown may slip further out of reach.

31.speaker: Gale
31.text: If you seek my input, you've only to ask.
31.context: NodeContext: Serious, this is a big decision

33.speaker: Gale
33.text: Fate seems determined to make a mindflayer of you, as it would make a cataclysm of me. Make your choice - the orb will be there regardless.

40.speaker: Gale
40.text: If the path we tread were easy, there'd be a queue of fools willing to walk it. Alas, it isn't. And such grim choices must fall to us.

37.speaker: Gale
37.text: I trust you to know the course we must take. But my offer stands - if none wish to shoulder the illithid's burden, the orb would achieve the same ends.

61.speaker: Gale
61.text: There is, of course one more course to consider. The orb. None need shoulder the illithid's burden, if that is what you decide.

45.speaker: Gale
45.text: Barely awake a moment, and the prince of the githyanki demands you surrender your soul?
45.context: NodeContext: Serious, this is a big decision

46.speaker: Gale
46.text: I confess, in my head I saw that going a lot less amicably. I hope our newly-freed ally proves more reliable than the last.

56.speaker: Gale
56.text: Fate seems determined to make a mindflayer of you. It remains your choice, as the crown remains mine.

57.speaker: Gale
57.text: The scent of Netheril hangs heavy in this place. The brain is close, as is the crown. I'm glad we face such a monster together.

69.speaker: Gale
69.text: The aura of Netheril hangs heavy in this place. The brain is close, as is the crown. As is victory, dare we begin to hope...

17.speaker: Player
17.text: I hope that wasn't our only chance. We must get hold of that crown.

86.speaker: Gale
86.text: Though I confess, the prospect of trying to outwit a brain the size of Mount Waterdeep is a challenge even for me.

65.speaker: Player
65.text: These could be our final moments. Time enough for a kiss.

10.speaker: Gale
10.text: I hope that wasn't our last kiss. I'd take a thousand more if I could.

106.speaker: Player
106.text: How do you like my new look?

23.speaker: Gale
23.text: I'd be lying if I said it wouldn't take some getting used to, but what can a few extra tentacles do to a bond as strong as ours?
23.context: NodeContext: not overly bothered, takes it in his stride

101.speaker: Gale
101.text: When this is all over, we'll have time enough to unpick the specifics of your new condition. Psionics alone could take months to thoroughly evaluate, not to mention the matter of your diet -
101.context: NodeContext: Getting excited at the prospect of learning about your new form

103.speaker: Gale
103.text: But I'm getting ahead of myself. We've a Netherbrain to defeat. Then we get to the fun stuff.

87.speaker: Player
87.text: How do you feel about using the orb, if all else fails?

75.speaker: Player
75.text: We'll soon be close enough for you to use the orb. How are you feeling?

38.speaker: Gale
38.text: I'd need a ream of parchment longer than an elder brain's stem to capture the tumult I feel at that particular prospect.

109.speaker: Gale
109.text: But I'm ready, if that's the word you need to hear. If you call on me, I will not let you down.

100.speaker: Player
100.text: What will you do when we get hold of the crown?

11.speaker: Gale
11.text: 'When?' I'm glad you have such confidence in our endeavour. I confess, my own's not constructed from such immutable materials.

7.speaker: Gale
7.text: I made a promise to my goddess. One I will do my best to keep. For the sake of this city, I can only hope that my best will be enough.

77.speaker: Gale
77.text: I challenged my goddess, defied her will, and promised her destruction.

79.speaker: Gale
79.text: Fail to get the crown after all that, and if the embarrassment doesn't finish me off, Mystra might.

54.speaker: Gale
54.text: I don't dare to picture the crown in my hands - not when there's the small matter of an enormous, city-conquering brain beneath it.

84.speaker: Gale
84.text: But if, if, we overcome that obstacle, I will do everything.

32.speaker: Gale
32.text: I don't dare to imagine making such a decision when there's the small matter of the enormous brain beneath the crown still to overcome.

25.speaker: Gale
25.text: Ask me again when the illithid scourge has been wiped from this city, and I'll have an answer for you. Until then - it's best not to count on anything.

15.speaker: Player
15.text: Do you think we stand a chance against the Netherbrain?

2.speaker: Gale
2.text: I'm cautiously optimistic. Though with the time left to us, and the amount still to be done, it's best we don't take anything for granted.

34.speaker: Gale
34.text: Who knows what shape these final moments of ours might assume? Not I. Not Mystra. Not even you. But whatever my fate might be, I'll be glad to greet it in such fine company.

74.speaker: Gale
74.text: Strolling these streets together would have been quite magical, in other circumstances. This is all a tad apocalyptic for my liking.

83.speaker: Gale
83.text: You're okay - thank the heavens and hells and everything in between. I thought the brain would take you from me.

96.speaker: Gale
96.text: I'm not sure I ever considered the Emperor an ally, exactly, but even so, it's strange to know we're on our own at last.

104.speaker: Gale
104.text: The High Hall was once a beacon of promise, of wisdom, of celebration. Now... well , it's just a beacon, and for all manner of horrors. A pity.
104.context: NodeContext: Referring to the fact the high hall is on fire/wrecked

105.speaker: Gale
105.context: NodeContext: Mentally preparing himself for the prospect he might die when you face the brain
